topics.body:
Trashboat; there will never be real life mechas.

They don't make sense militarily and the closest you'll ever get to seeing real life mechas would be smart tanks meant to go on terrain tanks can't go.  Those would look less like mechas and more like GEKKOS that only use their legs when on surfaces treads can't go.

topics.body:
To further shoot down people's hopes of ever seeing giant robots you're forgetting how much energy it would cost to move something that large.  In order move something the size of say the Chrysler building you would need a nuclear fusion reactor just to move it and it's armor would be so thin that the best course of action would to be to go shadow of colossus on it's ass cause it's armor would be paper thin.

Just climb up it and start popping a cap in the supermagnets' control system and the entire thing would fall over cause no control for the fusion reactor's supermagnets means it would shut off and fall over with no way of stopping it from becoming torn tissue paper.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
